summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1303: Golem (Arceus)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1303: Golem (Arceus)
body:
Hey look, it’s a Golem card! You know what that means! High HP, high Retreat Cost, and high Energy costs! This also came with pretty decent damage as well. Cards like this tended to fall just a bit short, but occasionally one would shine through and the basic stats here weren’t that bad so Golem was still worth a look.

140 HP was a good number, even for the standards of a Stage 2. The +30 Grass Weakness was a bit of a pain with Jumpluff and Beedrill both being quite good, especially in DP-On. On the other hand, there was a -20 Lightning Resistance, helpful against Luxray GL LV.X. Golem needed 4 Energy to retreat, so some other way to get this Pokemon back to the Bench was absolutely required.

Lunge Out only did 50 damage, but it wasn’t too bad for just 2 Energy. Not something to rely on all game by any means, but it was decent early on.

Tumble Down was interesting. It required 3 Energy on Golem and you needed to discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you wanted from your hand. The attack dealt 30 damage for each Energy you discarded. This was not reliable at all. That being said, it was Golem’s strongest attack and lacked a damage cap, so it could get a big KO every once in a while.

Rock Tumble’s 80 damage was consistent and not affected by Resistance, but it also needed 4 Energy and was therefore quite costly. If you got it going, it was good, but that was hard.

Golem was a bit slower than other Fighting-types and therefore failed to make it into a competitive deck. It wasn’t bad enough to be laughable in a less serious deck, since it had solid damage output and high HP, so if you wanted to use Golem for whatever reason this could work to an extent. Just don’t expect Golem to reach the power of Machamp or Donphan.

summary: Articuno Day announced for Pokémon GO - Bulbanews
title: Articuno Day announced for Pokémon GO - Bulbanews
description: Articuno Day is a reward for completing Professor Willow’s Global Challenge in Pokémon GO. If the challenge is completed, players can receive rewards until July 9.

title: Trading for a Shiny Miltank!!
body:
Hey, shiny hunters!! I’m looking for a shiny Miltank!
I don’t really care for the nature, IVs/EVs, level, etc.
The only thing I truly ask is for her name to be Space cow!!

Also, I use SM/USUM, but if you use XY/ORAS, I can work my way around it as well, so don’t worry!

I’m offering one/two of these shinies!!
But if you’re interested in some other shiny, don’t be afraid to ask! I may have it!

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Gothita Family
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Gothita Family
body:
574: Gothita

Ehhhh. Ya’ll know how I get when we’re in the territory of Pokemon that seem a little more human than they should be. It’s not the worst offender of course. I will admit that the whole goth aesthetic does fit right at home with an American region. So I can see why they felt the need to make a Pokemon after it. And kudos for not going the far-too-predictable Dark type and instead going for Psychic. (Though, this line would’ve been a leg up on Inkay if it had snuck in a Dark/Psychic typing first)

Personal Score: 5.5/10

This line’s just not gonna be my thing, the sad truth is.

575: Gothorita

This line does also carry the aesthetic of really creepy, haunted-looking dolls. Which I doubt is much of an accident, considering Gothita is known for just staring and staring, while Gothorita here pulls a Hypno and can hypnotically control sleeping children. As much as I just don’t gel with these guys, they’re among the better way to pull off some awkwardly humanoid critters.

Personal Score: 5.5/10

Enjoy the praise ya edgy teenage PSYCHIC-POWERED CHUCKIE……….

576: Gothitelle

This line also gets a bit into “the stars grant them their powers.” Sure, that’s a common theme for Psychic types in general, but is astrology a thing goths are into? I guess I wouldn’t be too surprised either way. Gothitelle uses those weird head-fins to get its power from astrology. Which apparently tells it exactly how long its trainer and any other closest friends have to live. No wonder this line is so brooding.

Gothitelle looks a little bit better to me by just a hair. Mostly because to go off of the creepy doll look, Gothitelle almost wouldn’t look too out of place in a doll-collecting grandma’s old display case wouldn’t it? That’s an oddly specific thing to praise I suppose, but…

Personal Score: 6/10

Sure. I’ll give it that anyways.

Overall:

They’re nice and creepy so I can fully get why somebody would love them. They’re just not my cup of tea.

[Archive]
